title: POTOMAC RIVER UPDATE — LOW FLOW ENDURES DESPITE RAIN

und.value:
Potomac River flow remains well below normal today (Mon., Oct 16), at 1.7 billion gallons per day (bgd), about 10 percent below normal, despite the hard rains of the past weekend, according to the U.S. Geological Survey. Normal flow during October is about 2.0 bgd.

NOTE: NEWS MEDIA ARE INVITED TO INTERVIEW AND PHOTOGRAPH USGS HYDROLOGISTS MAKING A SPECIAL MEASUREMENT OF THE LOW FLOW OF THE POTOMAC RIVER, NEAR THE BRIDGE AT POINT OF ROCKS, MD., WED., OCT. 18, 1995, BEGINNING AT 9:00 A.M.

CALL REBECCA PHIPPS IN THE USGS PUBLIC AFFAIRS OFFICE AT (703) 648-4460, FOR FURTHER DETAILS.
